result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing MARCH 8, 2016 received and filed. (4 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to JOSHUA M. MATHY, ADA  821 W. STATE ST. #405  MILWAUKEE, WI 53233-1427.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of VEREDICT commencing JANUARY 15, 2016 received and filed. (13 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to JOSH MATHY
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.

Attorney Victor M. Arellano in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel appeared via telephone and informed the court that he still has not been able to contact his client.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
WARRANT NEEDS TO BE REISSUED AND DATED FOR 3.8.16.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
from Agent Fargo.
Request for payment of $17.00 witness fees for witness Sharon D. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191001 in court 1x on 1/14/16.
received and filed from Attorney Arellano.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 1/15/16 for Sharon D. for 1 appearance on 1/14/16.
Sworn as interpreter: Alejandra Klaric.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Joseph C. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the hour of 04:29 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO COUNT 1 of 3rd Degree Sexual Assualt which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.     Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 7.  PSI ordered by the Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa and Alejandra Kalric.
Trial resumed at 9:23 am.  Court gives jury instructions. State and defense make closing arguments.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:00 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Johnson and Gee who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Sworn as interpreter: Alejandra Kalric and Dawn Maldonado.
Trial resumed at 1:40 pm. Sworn for the state:  Kimberly N., St. Francis Detective Kevin Weines  Exhibits 10, 11, 1, 6, 2, 1, 16 (Clerk did not receive this exhibit and tried to obtain it from parties) received.  Jurors released for afternoon break at 3:02 pm returning at 3:20 pm. State rests subject to rebuttal.   Jurors released for afternoon break at 4:21 pm returning at 4:44 pm. Court denies defense motion to dismiss. Defense rests. Jurors released for the date at 4:57 to return at 9 am.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa and Dawn Maldonado.
Trial proceeded at 9:16 am. Jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Sworn for the state:  Sharon D., JoAnn N., Saint Francis PD. Detective Jeremy Hacus Exhibits  12, 3, 1, 8, 6, 7 received.  Jurors released for lunch at 11:42 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:15 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Court gave preliminary instructions to the jury.  Jury adjourned at 3:54 pm and instructed to return the next day 1/14/2016 at 9:00 am.
Court proceeded on State's motion in limine.  Court grants the motions in limine in part and takes #2 motion in limine under advisement. 
Court proceeded on defense motions in limine which are granted.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  At assistant at defense counsel is Rita Richter.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreters:  Dawn Maldonado and Enrique Barbosa   Deputy court clerk:  vk  Jury trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Second Motion in Limine, received and filed

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Kevins Shomin for Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Per Judge McAdams this case can be scheduled off the record. Case still in trial posture.
Court is down on 12.10.15 case is adjourned to 1.8.16.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Yvon Roustan. Defendant denies the state's offer and has just received new discovery.   Court grants state's motion to dismiss counts 2-3 without prejudice.  The state will be proceeding to trial with Count 1 and defense is in agreement with this.   Case adjourned for final pretrial on 12.10.15 and for jury trial on 1.13.16.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
received from Victor Arellano.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Ruth Garcia. Parties are unable to agree to a factual basis.  Court vacates guilty plea.   Case adjourned for final pretrial on 11.9.15 and for jury trial on 11.18.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 11-09-2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Vicki Bermudez. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-08-2015 at 08:30 am.
received from Attorney Arellano.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNTS 1 and 3 DISMISSED.  AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss for Due Process Violation.
Defendant's Disclosure of Witnesses received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Defendant's Motions in Limine (two) to Issue a Preliminary Order with attached cover letter received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defense counsel submitted three motions to the Court via fax yesterday, but the Court will not accept filings via fax. Defense counsel will submit originals to the Court. Discussion regarding the jury trial date in this case. Due to judicial rotation the jury trial in this case needs to be rescheduled. Parties advised as of 8/01/15 this case will be assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7 in Room 620 of the Safety Building. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Motion hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Sworn as Interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1 remains the same. 

COUNT 2- Public Fornication, contrary to sec. 944.15(2), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor. 

COUNT 3- Disorderly Conduct, contrary to sec. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b) Wis. Stats., a Class B Misdemeanor. 

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived reading. Defendant pled not guilty.
Substantive jury instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine with attached cover letter received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. State placed offer on the record, which the defendant rejected. Parties to file motions by 5/14/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. State may file additional charges. Discussion regarding defendant's ability to understand the proceedings. Court will have an interpreter present for all future court dates. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Original Transcript (21 pages) commencing 04/14/2015 PRELIMINARY HEARING AND ARRAIGNMENT received and filed.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kevin Weins-St. Francis Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed, Faxed copy of DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO ADJOURN PRELIMINARY HEARING.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez not in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Attorney Victor Arellano via telephone.  Defense Counsel is not able to appear before the Court on previously scheduled court date appearance of April 2, 2015 at 1:30 pm.  State does not object to an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE. Defendant will be advised through counsel that he is to appear on the next scheduled court date agreed upon by the parties and approved by the Court.  Previously scheduled court date of April 2, 2015 is vacated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-02-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jose Chavez-Sanchez in court with attorney Victor M. Arellano.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
